meta.why: Proper hydration is essential for maintaining healthy fascia - the connective tissue that surrounds muscles and organs. Dehydrated fascia becomes stiff and can contribute to pain and restricted movement.

hero.title: Hydration & Fascia
hero.subtitle: Why water counts for pain relief
hero.description: Your fascia is 70% water. When dehydrated, it becomes sticky and restrictive, leading to pain and limited mobility. Proper hydration keeps fascia supple and functional.

tiles.title: **Fascia Needs Water**
content: Dehydration makes fascia sticky and stiff

tiles.title: **Hydration Guidelines**
content: Aim for 0.5-1 oz per pound body weight
Increase intake during exercise or heat

tiles.title: **Hydration Tips**
content: Start each day with 16-20 oz water
Keep water bottle visible and accessible

microAction.title: Hydration Check
microAction.description: Check your urine color right now. If it's darker than pale yellow, drink 16-20 oz of water immediately.
microAction.action: Set hourly water reminders on your phone
